Uses of Class
org.eclipse.core.commands.State

  • Packages that use State 
    Package Description
    org.eclipse.core.commands
    Application programming interfaces for commands and handlers.
    org.eclipse.jface.commands
    Provides JFace-specific support for commands.
    org.eclipse.jface.menus
    Provides support for trim specification.
    org.eclipse.ui.handlers
    Provides support for integrating handlers into the Eclipse workbench.

    • Uses of State in org.eclipse.core.commands

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      State IObjectWithState.getState(String stateId)
      Gets the state with the given id.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds a state to this handler.
      void Command.addState(String id, State state)
      Adds a state to this command.
      void IObjectWithState.addState(String id, State state)
      Adds state to this object.
      void IStateListener.handleStateChange(State state, Object oldValue)
      Handles a change to the value in some state.

    • Uses of State in org.eclipse.jface.commands

      Subclasses of State in org.eclipse.jface.commands 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PersistentState
      This is a state that can be made persistent.
      class  ToggleState
      A piece of state storing a Boolean.

    • Uses of State in org.eclipse.jface.menus

      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      A piece of state carrying a single String.

    • Uses of State in org.eclipse.ui.handlers

      Subclasses of State in org.eclipse.ui.handlers 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  RadioState
      This state supports a radio-button like command, where the value of the parameterized command is stored as state.
      class  RegistryRadioState
      A radio state that can be read from the registry.
      class  RegistryToggleState
      A toggle state that can be read from the registry.
